basics.name: Thinegan Ratnam
basics.label: Head of IT Infrastructure
basics.summary: Hi, my name is Thinegan Ratnam and I’m a Stack Developer based in Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia. I have over 10 years of experience in building system for Internet business, mostly in Unix environment. I have a thorough and practical understanding of how programming languages, application servers, database design, and networking technologies tie together to make useful and scalable web applications.

location.address: Publika, Solaris Dutamas, No. 1 Jalan Dutamas 1

work.summary: MoneyLion, is a data-driven products that enable a better financial future for customers. Data doesn't just enable us to deliver smarter loans, it also empowers our customers to make better financial decisions.
highlights: Made the transition of the database from standalone to a replication structure by supporting failover and high availability support
Rolled out a complete Agile Development Environment for the development team
Achieved and maintaining compliance and security throughout the infrastructure
Help to build a realtime BigData Infrastructure for the data analytic team

work.summary: I worked on Binary.com, a provider of fixed-odd financial contracts, as an employee of Regent Markets (the site’s owner) for 4 years. The service has a large user base, and I worked to maintaining the system and bring it forward. I learned a lot about the dynamics of a system engineering during my time there, from how to have the discipline to writing quality perl code, to the difficulties of managing and keeping over 50 servers secure all around the world. Definitely my pragmatism, attitude toward Getting Things Done.
highlights: Setup and maintains multiple servers all around the world
Ensuring infrastructures securities are all up-to-date and meets all the compliances requirement
Working together with datacenter's vendors to ensure smooth workflow from purchasing, to shipping, to installation in datacenter racks
Analyze SLA, contract and term of services provided before making the suitable purchases

work.summary: I worked on RMG Technology, a provider of fixed-odd financial contracts, as an employee of Regent Markets (the site’s owner) for 4 years. The service has a large user base, and I worked to maintaining the system and bring it forward. I learned a lot about the dynamics of a system engineering during my time there, from how to have the discipline to writing quality perl code, to the difficulties of managing and keeping over 50 servers secure all around the world. Definitely my pragmatism, attitude toward Getting Things Done.
highlights: Provide tech support to both office team and telecommuters who work around the round
Help to perform testing and minor bug fixing
Manage company's domains and tech assets
